title: MetaMask Blocks DuckDuckGo Search Results in Firefox
content:
Hello, I am experiencing an issue where the MetaMask extension in Firefox is blocking search results on DuckDuckGo. When I disable MetaMask, the search results load properly, but when it's enabled, they do not appear. This problem does not occur in other browsers like Brave.

I have tried: 

   Disabling and re-enabling MetaMask.    Adjusting Firefox's privacy settings.    Running Firefox in Safe Mode (which fixes the issue but disables all extensions).

Is there a known compatibility issue between MetaMask and DuckDuckGo on Firefox? Any suggestions on how to fix this without having to disable MetaMask?

Thanks in advance for any help!
creator: clementeacosta

title: I just saw in the upper right hand corner that something activated.
content:
I was on YouTube and in the upper right hand corner there was a small splash screen that said Activated with words underneath. It did not show but a couple of seconds so I couldn't read what activated.

I did not change anything. How do I find out what happened? I don't see you offer any logs.

PS I don't know if it was YouTube or not Firefox. But I have never seen it before.

It was rectangle with cream white background, black font, Activated was in large font, under it was smaller font. It covered the hamburger and 3 of the icons in your toolbar. It was half on the viewable window page (YouTube) and half over your icons.
creator: guttermedic

title: How can I delete places.sqlite? Privacy concern.
content:
places.sqlite: this file records EVERY website I've ever visited in a db table! This despite opting out of History and flushing daily It's frustrating that FF surreptiously collects such personal info. Why record every site I visit, date-timestamps, frequency, etc.?

moz_historyvisits_dateindex ON moz_historyvisits (visit_date) moz_places_lastvisitdateindex

As test, I changed the name to places-sqlite.old to see if FF will create a new one It didn't make a new table; re-created the old one.

I need to update FF because of the expired certificates, but would like to clear these out first. Similarly, can I get rid of the icon database? My bookmarks are backed up as JSON and HTML files. I just wished they didn't contain extraneous info

title: Why is Firefox blocking certain websites?
content: Firefox may block certain websites due to security features designed to protect users from harmful content, including phishing sites, malware, and other online threats. The browser uses built-in tools like **Enhanced Tracking Protection** and **Safe Browsing** to block malicious sites. Sometimes, websites may be blocked due to incorrect settings or conflicts with extensions or security software. Users can check if a website is being blocked by Firefox in the address bar or through the **Privacy & Security** settings. If a trusted site is blocked, users can add exceptions or disable certain security features, though this can expose them to risks.
